profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday April 29, 2019 at 21:00

repository.corpname: Yale Center for British Art, Rare Books and Manuscripts

did.abstract: The collection comprises 147 photographs from the late 19th and early 20th centuries, with representative images of Great Britain, South Africa, New Zealand, Madeira, East Asia, and other locations (many unidentified).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Keith Marshall Collection of Photographs, Yale Center for British Art, Gift of Keith (Yale BA 1968) and Millie Marshall.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The collection is the physical property of the Yale Center for British Art. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Keith (Yale BA 1968) and Millie Marshall, 2012

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into three series: I. People; II. Places; III. Oversize.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises 147 photographs from the late 19th and early 20th centuries, with representative images of Great Britain, South Africa, New Zealand, Madeira, East Asia, and other locations (many unidentified). The various components of the collection were acquired by Keith Marshall during the course of his collecting of material on John Ruskin. The photographs were not, thus, assembled as an intentional (thematic) collection; they nonetheless provide an interesting selection of commercial, travel, and personal images of the late Victorian and early Edwardian periods.

The names of photographers are recorded on a number of the photographs. They include E.E. Caney, George Henry Hana, Arthur Nicholls, Alex Rambert, Thomas Daniel Ravenscroft, Scott Wilkinson, S.A.C. Williams, Brown Barnes & Bell, Martin and Sallnow, Pulman and Son Photographers, Sallo Epstein & Co., and the Territorial Studio (Umtata, South Africa).
The photographs are organized in topical groups, the most significant parts of which are as follows.

Maude Douglas: The collection includes a set of cabinet cards of the young actress, Maude Douglas, who performed, among other places, at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, in the 1890s. She was likely a dancer or other minor performer in burlesque theater. According to a partial inscription on one cabinet card, she appeared in an 1892 production of Faust up to date , a popular spoof of the legendary opera. These cards document theatrical costume and makeup of the fin de sieÌ€cle, and evidence a young woman's perhaps fleeting career in show business. There is one letter and a calling card from Douglas as well. These items show that she also went by the name "Maude Francis" and married a Mr. Elliott.

Domestic interiors and exteriors: A significant part of the collection consists of photographs of interiors and exteriors of an affluent British or British-style home around the turn of the century, offering representative glimpses of interior decoration and domestic architecture of the period.

South Africa: The collection contains many images of various locations in South Africa, documenting the landscape and architecture of this area around the turn of the twentieth century. Locations represented include Cape Town and Durban.

Mariannhill Monastery: Among the oversize material are a set of album pages containing photos of Mariannhill, a Benedictine monastery that was founded in the 1880s, in Durban, South Africa. It was unusual for having its own photography and printing studio, and some of the images in this set seem to have come from this studio. The photos document the monks' daily lives and work, as well as missionary education in South Africa.

Mauritius: There are many images--most of them commercially produced, by Alex Rambert--of the island of Mauritius. These depict both landscapes and architectural scenes in and around the town of Reduit, in the 1880s or 1890s.

Venice: The collection includes a large set of commercially produced souvenir photographs of Venice (Italy), printed by the German company, Neue Photographische Gesellschaft (NPG). The NPG, an early example of a large-scale commercial photography business, established efficient and cost-effective printing processes and were an important part of European commercial photography in the 19th and 20th centuries.

Maori of New Zealand: There are a handful of large-scale portraits of Maori tribespeople and leaders. Identical images and negatives, matching some of the items in the present collection, are in the collection of the Museum of New Zealand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Calling card reading "Miss Maude Douglas, M. Van Biene's Companies, and Royal Opera House, Leicester." Dated in graphite, "Jany. 1892."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Maude Douglas (signed "Maude Francis") dated Feb. 8 1892 (in graphite, perhaps at a later time), addressed to "old Boysie" and indicated as coming from "Theatre Royal/Drury Lane." Maude writes her friend to say that she is enclosing a photograph "as you desired" but that she has not been able to be photographed in her "Portugal dress" because "they cannot allow it until later on." She asks her correspondent to write and give her his/her opinion

unittitle.emph: Maude Douglas portrait, bust-length profile, white dress

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Portrait of Maude Douglas by Brown, Barnes, and Bell of Liverpool. Image shows Maude in profile, wearing a low-necked white dress or blouse that sits loosely on her shoulders. Her hair is pinned up in an informal way, not stiffly styled, and she has a fringe of curls framing her face. She wears no jewelry. Her lack of adornment, her naturalistic hairstyle and her soft neckline suggest that this photograph was taken perhaps as a performer's 'head-shot,' showcasing her natural features and beauty to greatest advantage.

unittitle.emph: Maude Douglas portrait, full length seated, white dress

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This image and the profile image in the same group appear to have been taken at the same time, as part of a series. The print is dated "April 1892" in graphite on reverse. Maude is shown here in a loose and diaphanous white gown, with open sleeves that drape over her shoulders. Tassels adorn the dress at the arms and one at the waist. She wears no jewelry and her hair is done in a soft, natural, style.

unittitle.emph: Maude Douglas portrait, checked blouse and pin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Portrait of Maude Douglas is signed on reverse: "With Love from Maude/ D'cr [December] 9th 96." Image shows Maude looking straight at the camera, with curly bangs above her forehead. She wears a simple high-necked gingham or checked blouse, pinned at the neck with a small brooch.

unittitle.emph: Maude Douglas portrait, bust length, wool coat

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed on reverse, "Maude. Feb'y 1891." Image shows Maude looking straight at the camera, wearing a heavy coat and a feather-trimmed hat. She wears a brooch at her neck, but no other jewelry.

unittitle.emph: Maude Douglas portrait, full length, Greco-Roman gown

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Print is signed on back, "To Bertie with much love from Maudie." Image is of Maude standing with arms clasped behind her head. She wears a loosely-fitting, draped gown suggestive of ancient Greek or Roman style. She has a solid metallic bracelet on her right arm, and she wears heavy makeup.

unittitle.emph: Maude Douglas portrait, full length seated, 'royal' costume,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Maude is shown here wearing a regal looking costume, consisting of a cap with pheasant feathers, a fur-trimmed striped bodice with dark fabric bib and cuffed sleeves (cuffs are a pale velvety material, with frilly wrists), a cape decorated with spangles, tasseled epaulets, thick black tights and low heeled black shoes. She is wearing heavy makeup, with her eyes lined and lips rouged. The print is signed, "With love from Maudie/ Jan 29th 92."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Print is inscribed "April 1892" in graphite on reverse. Image shows Maude Douglas wearing a short military costume, consisting of a jacket embroidered with braid and piping and with wide lightweight cuffs, a sword slung across her body, a linked metallic belt with flags or some other military imagery stamped on each panel, a colorful sash, a cap, and gloves. Maude wears only thick pale-colored tights on her legs, with dark shiny boots that rise to mid-calf. She poses in a salute, with one hand on her sword.

unittitle.emph: Maude Douglas portrait, military costume, seated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The second of two portraits taken of Maude in her short military costume. This image shows Maude seated on the wooden table that appears in the other portrait. She appears to hold a cigarette or some other small item in her right hand, between the first two fingers. Image is dated "April 1892" in graphite on reverse.

unittitle.emph: Maude Douglas portrait, military costume, hand-colored presentation copy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Preserved in a slip of paper, in an envelope on which is written: "M.D. coloured herself/given me Sunday Oct. 9 1892/the week of her marriage to Mr. Elliott." This is a copy of the same print in which Maude appears saluting, in military costume. The print has been cut into a round-edged rectangle shape, perhaps for framing. On the reverse is part of an inscription from Maude, cut off when the print was resized: "Maude Douglas--'Faust up to [date]'." Faust up to date was a burlesque opera produced in the spring and summer of 1892.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The sitter is unidentified. The back of the original picture frame is inscribed: "To Frankie, uncle. Jan. 31, 1842, Pa.; Jan. 31, 1913 Fla."

unittitle.emph: Portrait of a young woman, with large hat

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Studio photograph of an unidentified sitter. The back of the frame has the printed label of Joseph Wilson, picture frame maker at London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Portrait of three young men, all dressed in suits. They pose together on a couch, a chair, and a table in what appears to be the photographer's studio. There is no indication of the identity of the three men or the occasion of this portrait. This photograph was found with other photographs and envelopes bearing a Cambridge University (St. John's College) address, so it is possible that the three men are students at the University, possibly at St. John's College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph preserved in envelope which reads, on inside of the flap, "Hetty Mitchell. June 3, 1889." Presumably, this portrait depicts Hetty. It shows a young woman in her 20s or 30s, wearing a domestic servant's uniform.

unittitle.emph: Portrait of an unidentified female performer

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An unidentified female performer, likely from London, is pictured in this print. She stands with hands at her hips, wearing a revealing costume composed of a frilled eyelet blouse with long full sleeves, a vest and shorts of a pale color with dark edging, pale tights, and white shoes.

unittitle.emph: Family portrait, with small black dog

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Family portrait of an unidentified man, woman, their five children, and a small dog. The family is arranged in the photographer's studio with mother and father seated at right and left, a young girl standing between them, and a small black dog on a pedestal in front. The family is dressed in what appear to be their best clothes, and the father wears a military jacket of some sort.

unittitle.emph: Portrait of mother and child, reading outdoors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Print shows an unidentified mother and child in a garden setting. The mother, seated on an upholstered chair, is dressed in a pale or white gown with an embroidered square neck and a lace collar. She holds open a book and appears to be reading to a young girl standing next to her.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified interior. One of a set of photographs showing interiors in a lavish home. Parquet wood flooring, oriental rugs, richly upholstered armchairs, a fireplace with carved/marble mantelpiece and floral screen, large sculptures, chandelier with crystal ornaments, and a large mirror with table underneath, containing various artifacts and decorative objects.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified interior, drawing room with curio cabinets and clock

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of unidentified interior of a lavish home. Wooden side chairs and a large velvet armchair, many wall and table-top decorations, fresh flowers, an ornate wall clock, and a large curio cabinet with glass windows on front/sides. China and crystal displayed in the cabinet. Chandelier with crystal ornaments, oriental rugs on parquet wood floor.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified interior, dining or breakfast room

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of unidentified dining room. A small round table is set with fine china and cloth napkins. Leather dining chairs surround table and are placed against wall. An ornate and robust wooden cabinet is at the back of the room. The cabinet has carved decorations on the front and wooden figures at top. A silver tea or coffee service is in the back corner of the scene. A large oriental rug covers the floor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of unidentified dining room, with a table setting for four. A tapestry and scrollwork fire screen is set in front of the fireplace, and several glass jars are set atop the mantel, in front of a mirror. The room has dark wood paneling on all walls. The chairs are upholstered in studded leather. A large woven rug is on the floor, and a sidebar with silver atop it is seen in the background. Electric sconces, each with a single bulb, are located on the walls.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified interior, living room or library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified living room. Two painted portraits are shown--a large one of three boys hangs over the fireplace (with elaborately carved mantel); a second depicts a woman in a low-necked dress. Various wall and free standing decorations, ornaments, throughout the room. A couch is covered in a patterned velvet textile, and several chairs appear grouped around an orientalist carved table.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph depicting an elaborately decorated sitting room. In the foreground, a couch appears with lace covered pillows and a vibrant floral upholstery. Two rugs can be seen on the floor, both large and also striking in appearance. A wooden rocking chair with additional cushions sits at left, with a closed hutch behind it. Books and photographs are housed in a shelving unit with a fabric skirt, in the background. The photographs depict various people and are likely family or friends' portraits.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified interior, living room or library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of unidentified living room or library in this series. A table is draped with a fringed covering, and large books or albums stacked in three groups atop it. Bookshelves with fine leather-bound volumes are visible in the background at left. A large stand or easel is also at left, in carved wood, with a portfolio resting on top of it. There is a heavy wooden desk with an unusual carved chair in front of it. The desk has a large lamp and other decorative items atop it. In the background, a long upholstered couch is built along the back wall. Framed images and some sculptural wall art are hung above it. There are armchairs and other lounging chairs at right, with the same tasseled-textile coverings as appear in the other photo of this room. A large sculpture of a muscular, bearded, man with a lion resting at his feet (perhaps Androcles and the lion?), stands at right on a pedestal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph depicts a dark wooden staircase that rises from left bottom to right top, with a long landing or balcony at right. Below the stairs is an open sitting area, presumably in the first floor main hall.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified stately brick home with glass walled conservatory at back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts an unknown property on a waterfront. Large brick or stone building with a conservatory and several turrets. A flag (Australian?) flies at the top of the tallest turret. A steamboat can be seen in the water at right, in the distance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified family group arranged casually on steps and front wall of a two story home with two chimneys and detailed trim. The home looks to be a modern one for its era, with long glass windows (a couple are opened on their hinges). There is a gravel drive and a landscaped garden with trees and rosebushes in the foreground.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified home and garden, exterior view

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph shows a half-timbered house with decorative Victorian-era design elements. Ivy grows thickly on the first floor of the house, which is shown from the side. A graveled drive runs to its right, and a small garden is shown in the foreground. There is another home in the background, at right, in this photograph.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of an unidentified, large half-timbered home, pictured likely around the turn of the twentieth century. No people appear in the image. The home appears at the base of an extensive graveled drive, with bushes and trees growing at the edges.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph depicting unidentified group of people (3 women, a man, and a male driver) with a parked car. Several pieces of luggage arranged on the running board. The women all wear head coverings (hats and veils) and a sole woman is standing by the car in a long duster coat. The driver wears a uniform. The car and clothing indicate that the image dates from the early 1900s or 1910s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph depicting unidentified trio of women with a car. Automobile appears early, but not of earliest design, so likely dates to 1910s or 1920s. The car is parked on a dirt road or path that is wooded on either side. Two women sit in the car, with the youngest woman at the wheel and an older woman next to her. A third woman poses jauntily with her foot on the running board. Her dress, shoes, wristwatch, and hairstyle seem to date this photograph to ca. 1915-1925. There is no information in or with the photograph, but it was found with a group of photos depicting scenes (exterior and interior) of a large home.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a landscaped road or driveway with trees and brush growing on banks at either side. No indication of location but found grouped with other images of interiors and domestic scenes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse. Depicts a naturally-formed pillar of rocks, with some plants growing at the base. A man stands near the foot of the pillar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph is unsigned, but found with stack labeled "Alex. Rambert photos." Depicts a dirt road running down the main section of a town, perhaps Pout Louis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse. Depicts a large series of waterfalls in a wooded valley, presumably in Mauritius.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of a lake, probably at Le Reduit, Mauritius. Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a lake surrounded by lush vegetation. Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph depicting lush vegetation with a lake at the center. Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a large complex with two house-like units on either side of a covered walkway, which lies over a pillared verandah, likely that pictured in the image entitled "Verandah of Reduit." Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts Labourdonnais Square, Port Louis, Mauritius, looking out towards the harbor, in which many tall-masted ships are seen. Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: It depicts a long avenue of tall palm trees, in Mauritius. Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a grove of trees with a grass-roofed gazebo or hut at left. Several local people are seen by the gazebo and one small boy stands on the right bank of a small lake or other body of water. Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a long avenue on the sides of which grow heavy clusters of palms and other vegetation. Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified shoreline, two men and child in a boat

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two men use long poles to guide a small boat towards a rocky shoreline. Presumably in Mauritius.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a long dirt avenue with large stone and iron fences on either side. Probably in Port Louis, Mauritius.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a large grassy field covered with people, who seem to be attending a kind of festival or race (a track rings the field). Has the ink stamp of "Alex. Rambert" on the reverse.

unittitle.emph: Zwartberg Pass, Prince Albert, Oudtshoorn Road

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a large craggy pass, with a woman or girl in Western dress standing on a dirt road running through it. Has the ink stamp of "T.D. Ravenscroft" of Rondebosch (Cape Town), on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a clearing in a rocky mountain pass, with a horse and buggy on a dirt road. Has the ink stamp of "T.D. Ravenscroft" of Rondebosch (Cape Town), on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts dirt roads running through a valley. Has the ink stamp of "T.D. Ravenscroft" of Rondebosch (Cape Town), on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a craggy rock pass with a body of water in the foreground. A man with a horse and buggy are at water's edge on the opposite bank from the photographer. Has the ink stamp of "T.D. Ravenscroft" of Rondebosch (Cape Town), on the reverse.

unittitle.emph: View of road and cliffs, South Africa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Has, on the reverse, the ink stamp of the Territorial Studio (Umtata).

unittitle.emph: Needles Hotel, Port St. Johns, Pondoland, South Africa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts "Needles Hotel," a small wooden-framed building. Has, on the reverse, the ink stamp of the Territorial Studio (Umtata).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a small set of buildings at the base of a large, craggy, hillside. Several people stand in a lawn or open space to the front of the buildings. Has, on the reverse, the ink stamp of the Territorial Studio (Umtata).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a group of people moving across a river or lake on a ferry moved by ropes strung across the water. Has, on the reverse, the ink stamp of the Territorial Studio (Umtata).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A view of the town of Grahamstown/Grahamstad, South Africa. The town appears at some distance, beyond a fenced in field in the foreground and a dirt road on which two people walk at right.

unittitle.emph: Cango Caves Exterior, Prince Albert, Oudtshoorn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts the exterior of the Cango Caves in Oudtshoorn, South Africa. Eight people stand in front--a group of men and boys, wearing Western garb and appearing to be tourists at the cave. Has the ink stamp of "T.D. Ravenscroft" of Rondebosch (Cape Town), on the reverse

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a busy street in Cape Town, with numerous buggies and trolleys, and showing a large building with a sign reading "J.D. Cartwright and Co." Has ink stamp of "Sallo Epstein & Co." on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a broad paved waterfront promenade in Durban. Several people are walking up and down the promenade or lounging on the lawns. Has ink stamp of "Sallo Epstein & Co." on the reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: View of the Umkomaas (Mkomazi) River, spanned by a long low bridge. The photograph is signed E.E. Caney.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: View of the Rand Hotel, with several people in front. One woman rides a horse side-saddle, and other people ride in buggies. The scene also depicts several servants wearing dark sashes. Signed, on front, by E.E. Caney.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Large mountains are in view. The scene is probably in South Africa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Titled in graphite on reverse, along with number ("2645"); presumably, the scene is Lovedale, South Africa. Depicts a landscape with grass-roofed huts and large plants growing in foreground.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Souvenir photograph depicting a young man in a checked blazer and straw hat being helped into/out of a gondola on the Grand Canal of Venice. Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

unittitle.emph: Venezia, Facciata di S. Marco, dettaglio, 3016

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts Piazza San Marco in Venice. Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

unittitle.emph: Venezia, Piazza e Basilica di S. Marco, 3022

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a man and woman feeding pigeons in the Piazza San Marco, in Venice. Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts the Doges' Palace, Venice. Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

unittitle.emph: Venezia, Cortile del palazzo dei Dogi, 3025

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts the courtyard of the Doges' palace in Venice. Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts an entrance to the Doges' Palace. Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts a man on a gondola in front of the Procuracy of St. Christopher. Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts the "Bridge of Sighs," with two gondolas rowing underneath. Blind-stamped on front: "Neue Photographische Gesellschaft, A.G., Berlin-Steglitz, 1900."

unittitle.emph: Kildonan Castle (Ship) at port in Funchal, Madeira

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts the Kildonan Castle steam ship at port in Funchal, Madeira. The ship was built in 1899 and went on to have a significant role in transport of troops and others between the UK and South Africa during the early years of the 20th century. On the reverse is the ink stamp of Dionizio da Camara Lomelino, photographer at Funchal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts an open air fish market in a town square of Funchal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts Funchal from a hilltop.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: View of Funchal, as seen from a hilltop overlooking it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: View of part of an unidentified coastal town, probably Funchal.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified Asian dwelling with man and snow

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Small house, perhaps Chinese, in snow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Depicts an unidentified rocky shoreline, with a few building in the distance.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified coastal scene, village and boats
Unidentified rocky shore, with small boats pulled in aground

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified shore, with rocks in foreground, grounded boats seen across a small waterway, and two-storey homes built side by side in background. A low stone wall with a tall watchtower appears at right. Likely the same coastal location as in other images found in this group of landscape photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified landscape, possibly American, with railcars bearing logs stopped at a station in a grassy, hilly area. The railcars are labeled "N.C.R.," which may stand for "Northern Central Railroad," operational in Pennsylvania and surrounding states in the 19th and 20th centuries. There are some buildings behind the station, in the background. All structures appear wooden, and are very simple in nature. No explicit indication of location for this photograph.

did.unittitle: Unidentified coastal area, with hills and sea

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified men and women lounge on deck chairs on a ship. Blinds are drawn partially to prevent too much sun from getting to the passengers.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified rocky shore, with five beachgoers
Unidentified rocky beach, with three beachgoers
Unidentified mountain pass, man standing on small bridge
Unidentified hillside with church and buildings in valley
Unidentified hotel or buildings in grassy hills
"Mammoth Post Card" showing Christ Church College, Oxford

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The postcard is not addressed.

unittitle.emph: Harrow Road School portrait, young boys

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Portrait of thirty young schoolboys with their teacher, who stands at the back of the group. There is a small marquee on which is chalked "Harrow Road, II," perhaps indicating second year students. The boys appear to be about six or seven years of age. Print is mounted on a decorative card with information about the Royal family printed on it and a celebratory message: "1837 Sixty Years Happy and Glorious Reign 1897."

unittitle.emph: Harrow Road School portrait, older boys

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Portrait of a class of boys aged roughly twelve or thirteen. Their teacher stands to the left of the group. All boys wear suits, not uniforms, and several have academic medals pinned to their jackets. A small marquee has "Harrow Road [?]" chalked on it. Print is mounted on a decorative card with information about the Royal family printed on it and a celebratory message: "1837 Sixty Years Happy and Glorious Reign 1897."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: School portrait of a group of girls aged about ten. The girls all wear what appear to be their best dresses, not uniforms. A female teacher sits in the middle of the group, and another woman stands at top right. Potted plants are placed around the front row of seated girls. Print is mounted on a decorative card with information about the Royal family, and a celebratory message: "1837 Sixty Years Happy and Glorious Reign 1897."

unittitle.emph: Portrait of the "crew of the S Y [Royal Mersey Steam Yacht] Argo," June 1886.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Portrait of the crew shows assembled sailors and staff, including one or two chefs and two women who look to be either nurses or maids. "The Argo," a steam yacht appears to have been instrumental in scientific expeditions in the 1870s through the 1890s. It is referenced in the title of Henry Hugh Higgins's 1877 book, "Notes by a Field-Naturalist in the Western Tropics: From a Journal Kept on Board the Royal Mersey Steam Yacht, 'The Argo.'" A small graphite sketch appears on the mounting card. It shows a view of a bay edged by mountains. It is labeled, in pen and ink, "Getting towards Kingstown Sugarloaf Mountain, June 6."

unittitle.emph: Drawing Room at Melton Mowbray / Morning in India

did.physdesc: 2 albumen prints, mounted on opposite sides of a card ; 25.5 x 32.5 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photo on the front is labeled in pen and ink, "Drawing Room at Melton Mowbray." It depicts a large Victorian drawing room, heavily furnished and decorated. Several framed paintings and mirrors hang on the walls, and many ornaments adorn surfaces around the room. A woman sits reading a newspaper and a large dog sleeps at her feet. Another woman knits.
Photo on the reverse is labeled, in pen and ink, "Morning in India." It depicts a brushy hill seen from a distance, with dense scrubby brush growing in the foreground.

unittitle.emph: Church of St. Thomas of Canterbury, Whichelsea, 5th September 1895 / Eastbourne Regatta Day, 9th September 1895

did.physdesc: 2 albumen prints mounted on a card ; 24 x 28 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photo on the front depicts the Church of St. Thomas of Canterbury, clad in heavy ivy.
The photo on the reverse depicts Eastbourne Regatta Day (rowing). The image shows large crowds at water's edge, awaiting the regatta.

unittitle.emph: Mercery Lane, Canterbury, 7th September 1894 / Entrance gate, Canterbury Cathedral, and Marlow's monument, 7th Sept 1894

did.physdesc: 2 photographs mounted on either side of a card ; 24 x 27.5 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First image shows a street with shops along it leading into a small stone-paved lane. The shops' windows show an impressive selection of silver goods at "Fox and Trimnell" and a dress for sale at "E. & E. LeFevre Ladies and Childrens' Outfitters."
Second image shows a street view of Canterbury, with a portion of the Cathedral between what appear to be modern, nineteenth century buildings.

unittitle.emph: Unidentified beach, with many small boats and bathers

did.physdesc: 4 photographs mounted on a heavy cardboard sheet ; 16 x 12 cm (1 photo) and 12 x 16 cm (3 photos)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All four photographs depict water features in a hilly terrain.

unittitle.emph: Paul Paora Tuhaere, Chief Orakie / Queen Aotea, Second Wife of King Tawhiao

did.physdesc: 2 albumen prints, mounted on opposite sides of a black paper sheet ; 28 x 22 cm (Chief) 28 x 21 cm (Queen)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bust-length portrait of Paul Paora Tuhaere, a Maori Chief in Auckland, New Zealand. Portrait shows the chief wearing Western-style suit with white bibbed shirt and bow tie. He has a short white beard and mustache, and his tribal facial tattoos can be seen clearly.
On the reverse is a portrait of Queen Aotea. She has short, dark, hair, and wears a traditional cloak with frilled collar and a feather in her hair. She has facial tattoos on her chin.
Both images are signed Pulman Photo.

controlaccess.subject: Maori (New Zealand people) -- Portraits
controlaccess.persname: Aotea, Queen, Second wife of King Tawhiao

unittitle.emph: Portrait of Wiremu and Rangitoia / Portrait of TaÌ„whiao, Maori King

did.physdesc: 2 albumen prints mounted on either side of a black paper sheet ; 27.5 x 21 cm (both images)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photo on the front depicts two Maori women, with names tattooed on their arms. One woman has the name "Wiremu" on her arm, and the other has "Rangitoia." The women touch foreheads, a traditional greeting.
On the reverse side is a portrait of Tawhiao, Maori King. He wears a heavy woven cloak and has elaborate facial tattoos.
Both images are signed by Pulman photo.

controlaccess.subject: Maori (New Zealand people) -- Portraits
controlaccess.persname: TaÌ„whiao, King of the MaÌ„ori, fl. 1860-1894

unittitle.emph: Cango Caves Interior, Prince Albert, Oudtshoorn Road

did.physdesc: 1 photograph in a cardboard mat ; 28.5 x 22.5 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With the ink stamp of T.D. Ravenscroft on the reverse.

did.physdesc: 2 photographs, mounted on single paper sheet ; 13.5 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two images of monks at the Mariannhill Monastery. The first shows monks at work making wine, perhaps. The second is labeled: "Refectorium, Mariannhill." The monks are at a meal, and eating silently while a reading is made by the monk sitting in a small elevated pulpit at right.

unittitle.emph: Monks at a stream, likely near Mariannhill Monastery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The monks are resting at a stream. With them are a few African boys who wear Western-style outfits of shirts, trousers, and suspenders, with straw hats.

unittitle.emph: Two photographs of classes, likely at (or near) Mariannhill Monastery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two images of education of South African children, likely at Mariannhill Monastery. The first image shows a nun teaching four girls how to sew. This may be a studio shot. The second photo depicts a class conducted outdoors.

unittitle.emph: A wedding procession, likely at Mariannhill Monastery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files of men and women walk behind the bridal couple, and a monk looks on at right. Likely one of a series of photos taken at Mariannhill Monastery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The sails appear to be of Eastern design, perhaps Chinese.

unittitle.emph: Seven photographs of scenes in China

did.physdesc: 7 albumen prints, mounted on a large black paper sheet (both sides) ; 11.5 x 16.5 cm (each)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven images of Chinese architecture, citizens, landscapes. The images may be associated with the Mariannhill Missionaries.

unittitle.emph: Photograph of a settlement in Asia, possibly China

did.physdesc: 1 albumen print, mounted on large paper sheet ; 11.5 x 17 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The image may be associated with the Mariannhill Missionaries.

unittitle.emph: Four images of scenes in China / Two images of unidentified street scenes, possibly in Funchal

did.physdesc: 4 albumen prints, 2 photographs ; 16.5 x 12 cm and 12 x 16.5 cm (albumen prints) and 23.5 x 17.5 cm and 17.5 x 23.5 cm (photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The four albumen prints of scenes in China depict art, architecture, and local people. The images may be associated with the Mariannhill Missionaries.

unittitle.emph: Four images of scenes in China / Two images of Funchal (?)

did.physdesc: 4 albumen prints, 2 photographs, mounted on both sides of a paper sheet ; 11.5 x 17cm(albumen) 17.5 x 23.5 cm (photographs)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four images of various scenes in China, some of architecture, one rooftop view of a village, and one scene of a woman in Western dress holding an infant at some sort of stone building. Two images of Madeira, one labeled "Camara de Lobos." Possibly related to Mariannhill Mission/Monastery, represented in other images belonging to the same set of former album pages.

did.physdesc: 2 photographs, mounted on a large paper sheet ; 16 x 21 cm (each)
